Beanstalk looks a bit like markdown

But all of a sudden you can start using scenes.

Scenes are a way to group and style sections of your content. They can easily import , and can contain expressions. And it's all % clean, concise and readable.

Why use Beanstalk?

  • You can write your content naturally, without any HTML or CSS boilerplate.
  • Break out into using powerful compiled expressions anytime
  • Modern programming language syntax and modern UI sensibilities all in one file.
    • You can easily add variables into your scenes such as that float defined earlier (). And all of this content automatically gets wrapped in the approrpriate HTML tags and CSS classes.
